description: Geospatial location of the job for mapping and analysis; likely a GIS geometry. Confirm geometry type and coordinate reference with SME.
Unique system identifier for the work order used for tracking, reporting, and billing.
Code indicating whether work is in progress or completed; confirm allowable values and meaning with SME.
Date and time the work order was issued to the shop or technician.
Date and time the work order was completed and administratively closed.
Planned due date for completing the work.
Identifier of the primary technician or mechanic assigned to the work.
Identifier of the supervising person responsible for oversight; format may be ID or name.
Identifier of the crew lead in charge of field execution.
Code describing how the work originated (e.g., request, inspection, telematics). Confirm code set with SME.
Reference to the primary originating work request or parent request for this work order.
Identifier of the approver who authorized the work.
Classification of the requesting or billed party (such as internal department or external).
Identifier for the requestor or customer associated with the initial request.
Name of the customer or department associated with the work.
Mobile phone number of the requestor or primary contact.
Secondary phone number for the requestor or contact.
Email address for the requestor or primary contact.
User or account identifier from the request submission portal.
Identifier of the equipment operator/driver who reported the issue; confirm usage with SME.
Reference to a standardized issue/problem code; confirm domain and catalog with SME.
Original problem statement or service request text submitted by the requestor.
Additional comments provided with the initial request.
Notes entered by supervision regarding triage, decisions, or instructions.
Code indicating urgency/severity for scheduling and response; confirm code meanings with SME.
Structured request description text; purpose may overlap with other request fields—confirm usage.
Free-text notes related to the initial request.
Foreign key to the service location address where work occurs.
Street name of the service location.
Street number of the service location.
City of the service location.
Postal code of the service location.
Narrative description to help locate the job site or asset.
Nearest cross street for the service location.
Code for the maintenance shop, yard, or responsible location.
Timestamp when the record was created in the system.
User or process that created the record.
User-defined text field for agency-specific attributes; meaning configured locally. Confirm with SME.

User-defined numeric field for agency-specific tracking; meaning configured locally. Confirm with SME.
User-defined numeric field for agency-specific tracking; meaning configured locally. Confirm with SME.
User-defined numeric field for agency-specific tracking; meaning configured locally. Confirm with SME.
Foreign key to the requestor’s address record.
Street name for the requestor’s address.
Street number for the requestor’s address.
City for the requestor’s address.
Postal code for the requestor’s address.
Nearest cross street for the requestor’s location.
Department submitting or responsible for the request.
Date the service request was submitted or logged.
Free-text explanation describing why a request was denied.
Code indicating the reason a request was denied.
Indicator distinguishing corrective maintenance from preventive maintenance.
Identifier of the external service provider if work was outsourced.
Short summary describing the job scope, system, and component.
Narrative summary of repairs performed and actions completed.
Accounting or charge code to which costs are billed.
Management unit or cost center associated with the work.
Code representing the maintenance activity or task category.
Categorization of the work order (such as corrective, preventive, inspection); confirm code set.
Reference to a maintenance template, task model, or meter-based program; confirm meaning with SME.
Identifier for the maintenance schedule or event that generated the work.
Identifier of the originating work request linked to this order.
Project identifier if the work is tied to a project or capital program.
Name of the workgroup or shop responsible for executing the order.
Identifier of the billed customer or department for this work.
Department code associated with the asset or charged party.
Chronological notes and communications recorded on the work order.
Lifecycle status of the work order (e.g., open, completed, canceled); confirm codes with SME.
Estimated labor hours required to complete the job.
Estimated labor cost for the job.
Estimated internal equipment usage cost.
Estimated parts cost.
Estimated contractor or outside services cost.
Estimated miscellaneous charges.
Identifier of the asset or unit being serviced.
Code indicating the asset class or equipment type.
Actual total cost recorded for the order; may duplicate a calculated total—confirm definition with SME.
Quantity of work units completed (e.g., tasks or units); confirm metric with SME.
Actual labor hours posted to the order.
Actual labor cost posted to the order.
Actual internal equipment usage cost posted to the order.
Actual parts cost posted to the order.
Actual miscellaneous costs posted to the order.
Actual contractor or outside services cost posted to the order.
Calculated sum of all actual cost components posted to the order.
